hadiths.text: It was narrated that Imran bin Husain said:"The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said the salam after three rak'ahs of 'Asr, then he entered his house. A man called Al-Khibaq stood up and said: 'Has the prayer been shortened, O Messenger of Allah?' He came out angry, dragging his upper garment and said: 'Is he speaking the truth?' They said: 'Yes.' So he stood and prayed that rak'ah, then he said the salam, then prostrated twice, then he said the salam (again)

chapter.ara-name: باب ذِكْرِ الاِخْتِلاَفِ عَلَى أَبِي هُرَيْرَةَ فِي السَّجْدَتَيْنِ
chapter.eng-name: Mentioning the reports that differ from Abu Hurairah concerning the two prostrations
